skol.name: skol

skol_eleven.name: skol_eleven
skol_eleven.title: Le Centre des arts actuels Skol présente 11 de Steve Giasson
descriptions: To launch the fall cultural season, Skol presents 11, the first solo exhibition of the Montreal-based conceptual artist Steve Giasson.

Eleven years after the 9/11 terrorist strikes, one has to admit that the West has not recovered from the event: simmering, now nameless wars in which the Coalition has engaged, a global economic crisis, a climate of fear and distrust, all testify to the fact that our civilization has been shaken.

As part of 11, conceptual artist Steve Giasson multiplies borrowed materials, extensions, reflections, but also media, to propose a modest appraisal of the aftershocks of this “horrific spectacle” (Mondzain, 2002, p.9) and other foreboding signs and of its complex relationships with the image. He presents six works that attempt, through looped images and a growing proliferation of commentary about them, to “revisit [not just] the event itself, but rather its consequences, its mediatised manifestations.” (Enwezor, 2008. p.29)

Approximately 30,000 sheets of paper - on which is printed the conceptual poem 11, compiling all the comments surrounding a video on YouTube of the terrorist attack against the World Trade Center on Sept. 11, 2001 - arranged in two equal piles laying on the ground. Visitors are invited to take sheets with them. These will not be replaced.

Approximately 30,000 sheets of paper - on which is printed the conceptual poem 11, compiling all the comments surrounding a video on YouTube of the terrorist attack against the World Trade Center on Sept. 11, 2001 - arranged in two equal piles laying on the ground. Visitors are invited to take sheets with them. These will not be replaced.

Visitors are invited to take sheets with them. These will not be replaced.

buddha_de_bamiyan_1.name: buddha_de_bamiyan_1
buddha_de_bamiyan_1.title: BUDDHA OF BAMIYAN
descriptions: 1008 piece puzzle depicting a monumental statue of a standing Buddha (ca. fifth century AD) carved into the side of a cliff in the Bamiyan valley in central Afghanistan. It was dynamited and destroyed in March 2001 by the Taliban, as any human representation is prohibited by the doctrine of Wahhabism. The puzzle lays on the floor undone. Visitors are invited to do it or undo it, if it is completed.

blank_card_1.name: blank_card_1
blank_card_1.title: BLANK CARD (NOTHING TO SEE NOTHING TO HIDE)
descriptions: A 5"x 7" greeting card on which is printed a black and white picture of the WTC twin towers. The towers have been cut out and the card placed on a white pedestal with the cuttings.

black_boxes_1.name: black_boxes_1
black_boxes_1.title: BLACK BOXES
descriptions: Fifty four black DVD cases stacked on top of each other, containing fifty four pirated movies, burned on DVD, in which New York City is partially or completely destroyed or its inhabitants threatened: King Kong (1933), Deluge (1933), When Worlds Collide (1951), Invasion U.S.A. (1952), The Beast from 20,000 Fathoms (1953), Earth vs. the Flying Saucers (1956), The World, the Flesh and the Devil (1959), Fail-Safe (1964), Destroy All Monsters (1968), Planet of the Apes (1968), Beneath the Planet of the Apes (1970), Meteor (1979), Zombi 2 (1979), Escape from New York (1981), Q (1982), 2019, After the Fall of New York (1983), Endgame (1983), The Abyss (1989), A Troll in Central Park (1994), Daylight (1996), Mars Attacks! (1996), Independence Day (1996), Armageddon (1998), Deep Impact (1998), Godzilla (1998), A.I. Artificial Intelligence (2001), Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within (2001), The Time Machine (2002), The Core (2003), Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow (2004), The Day After Tomorrow (2004), Godzilla: Final Wars (2004), King Kong (2005), Absolute Zero (2005), 	 The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy (2005), War of the Worlds (2005), Disaster Zone: Volcano in New York (2006), Resident Evil Extinction (2007), I Am Legend (2007), The Happening (2008),  Cloverfield (2008), Disaster Movie (2008), NYC: Tornado Terror (2008), The Day The Earth Stood Still (2008), The Day the Earth Stopped (2008), War of the Worlds 2: The Next Wave (2008), Wall-E (2008), Watchmen (2009), Knowing (2009), Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs (2009), Skyline (2010), 2012: Ice Age (2011), The Avengers (2012), Dark Knight Rises (2012).

trigen.name: trigen
trigen.title: troisième génération

ai_weiwei_sunflower_seeds.name: ai_weiwei_sunflower_seeds
ai_weiwei_sunflower_seeds.title: Ai Weiwei, Sunflower Seeds + Eighty One Roman Busts (Made In China)
descriptions: 2012. Two hand-painted porcelain sunflower seeds, stolen by Steve Giasson in April 2011 at Ai Weiwei’s exhibition "Sunflower Seeds" at the Tate Modern in London (while the Chinese artist was still held by the authorities of his country) + 81 busts of Michelangelo's David in white plastic. The model was manufactured in China and sold in Canada for $ 2. Dimensions variable.
ai_weiwei_sunflower_seeds.otherDate: Exhibition "troisième génération" pad pépinière artistique daviers, 29 March to 8 April 2012, Angers.

la_recette_du_bonheur_receipe_of_happine.otherDate: Exhibition "troisième génération" pad pépinière artistique daviers, 29 March to 8 April 2012, Angers.

andy_warhol_has_been_shot.name: andy_warhol_has_been_shot
andy_warhol_has_been_shot.title: Andy Warhol has been shot
descriptions: Silkscreen inspired by Andy Warhol’s Death and Disasters Series, representing Warhol entering the ambulance after the attack against him by activist Valerie Solanas.
andy_warhol_has_been_shot.otherDate: Exhibition "troisième génération" pad pépinière artistique daviers, 29 March to 8 April 2012, Angers.
andy_warhol_has_been_shot.materials: 2012. Silkscreen on Bristol paper 200g/m<sup>2</sup>, edition 30 ex. 40 x 60 cm.

still_in_search.name: still_in_search
still_in_search.title: Still In Search
descriptions: During a trip to England, Steve Giasson sent to himself (in Montreal) a series of 13 postcards of Bas Jan Ader on his boat before he undertakes the journey in which he found death trying to cross the Atlantic, from USA to United Kingdom (in Search of the Miraculous, 1975). These postcards were then sent again, one by one, from Montreal to Angers, addressed to the curator Quentin Lannes, so they could cross the ocean again. Only eight of them reached their destination so far.
still_in_search.otherDate: Exhibition "troisième génération" pad pépinière artistique daviers, 29 March to 8 April 2012, Angers.
still_in_search.materials: 2011-2012. Silkscreen on cardstock, edition 13 ex. 10.16 x 17.78 cm each.

trigen.description: pad pépinière artistique daviers, 29 mars au 8 avril 2012, Angers
